author: Spark, Muriel
snippet: I might have been inspired to say more on that agreeable  morning, but he didn't wait. He was away down a side street and along another street and down one more, zigzag, as far and as devious as he could take himself from the Portobello Road.

title: The Complete Short Stories
author: Spark, Muriel
snippet: They took him to a nursing home. He was fairly quiet, except on Saturday mornings when they had a hard time of it to keep him indoors and away from the Portobello Road.

title: The Complete Short Stories
author: Spark, Muriel
snippet: They searched for him in the Portobello Road, but actually  he had gone off to Kent to the village near the scene of the Haystack Murder. There he went to the police and gave himself up, but they could tell from the way he was talking that there was something wrong with the man.

title: The Complete Short Stories
author: Spark, Muriel
snippet: "I saw Needle in the Portobello Road three Saturdays running," he explained, "and they put me in a private ward but I got away while the nurses were seeing to the new patient. You remember the murder of Needle – well, I did it.

title: The Complete Short Stories
author: Spark, Muriel
snippet: Kathleen and I had become very close friends. We met several times each week, and after our Saturday morning excursions in the Portobello Road very often I would accompany Kathleen to her aunt's house in Kent for a long weekend.

title: The Complete Short Stories
author: Spark, Muriel
snippet: Creams, toothpastes, combs and hankies, cotton gloves, flimsy flower ing  scarves, writing-paper and crayons, ice-cream cones and orangeade, screwdrivers, boxes of tacks, tins of paint, of glue, of marmalade; I always liked them but far more now that I have no need of any. When Saturdays are fine I go instead to the Portobello Road where formerly I would jaunt with Kathleen in our grown-up days. The barrow-loads do not change much, of apples and rayon vests in common blues and low-taste mauve, of silver plate, trays and teapots long since changed hands from the bygone citizens to dealers, from shops to the new flats and breakable homes, and then over to the barrow-stalls and the dealers again: Georgian spoons, rings, earrings of turquoise and opal set in the butterfly pattern of true-lovers' knot, patch-boxes with miniature paintings of ladies on ivory, snuff-boxes of silver with Scotch pebbles inset.

title: The Complete Short Stories
author: Spark, Muriel
snippet: But I do often have Masses said for Needle's soul." I doubt if George will ever see me again in the Portobello Road. He broods much over the crumpled snapshot he took of us on the haystack.

title: The Complete Short Stories
author: Spark, Muriel
snippet: From that day I was known as Needle. One Saturday in recent years I was mooching down the Portobello Road, threading among the crowds of marketers on the narrow pavement when I saw a woman. She had a haggard, careworn, wealthy look, thin but for the breasts forced-up high like a pigeon's.

title: The Complete Short Stories
author: Spark, Muriel
snippet: She was always fond of antique jewellery and of bargains. I wondered that I had not seen her before in the Portobello Road on my Saturday- morning ambles. Her long stiff-crooked fingers pounced to select a jade ring from among the jumble of brooches and pendants, onyx, moonstone and gold, set out on the stall.

title: The Complete Short Stories
author: Spark, Muriel
snippet: Then George climbed down, took up his bottle of milk and went his way. I suppose that was why he looked so unwell when I stood, nearly five years later, by the barrow in the Portobello Road and said in easy tones, "Hallo, George!" The Haystack Murder was one of the notorious crimes of that year.

title: The Complete Short Stories
author: Spark, Muriel
snippet: Shortly afterwards the byre-hand emigrated to Canada to start afresh, with the help of Skinny who felt sorry for him. After seeing George taken away home by Kathleen that Saturday in the Portobello Road, I thought that perhaps I might be seeing more of him in similar circumstances. The next Saturday I looked out for him, and at last there he was, without Kathleen, half-worried, half-hopeful.

title: The Complete Short Stories
author: Spark, Muriel
snippet: But she found that the Saturday mornings were a strain. He insisted on going to see me in the Portobello Road and would come back to insist that he'd murdered Needle. Once he tried to tell her something about Matilda, but Kathleen was so kind and solicitous, I don't think he had the courage to remember what he had to say.

title: The Complete Short Stories
author: Spark, Muriel
snippet: But he was kind to Kathleen. It was he who persuaded them to emigrate to Canada so that George should be well out of reach of the Portobello Road.
